result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Scott Roe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 3.
Count 2 read in and dismissed.
Defendant to report to Probation.
Court will grant early discharge from Probation after 2 years if the Defendant is in compliance with all the conditions of Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file and refund balance.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Mental Health Assessment and follow through with therapy and/or treatment.
-Medications taken as prescribed.
-Defendant to provide his Probation Agent with mental health records.
-MRT at the recommendation of the Agent.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

CO: Kutz, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Karl E. Anderson, DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore, DF: Michael Scott Roe appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 17TR2640, 16TR550, 16TR551, 16TR552, 16TR553, 16TR935 & 16CF41.  Set for SEH.  Attorney make argument.  Crt orders:

Ct. 1 to run concurrent to Ct. 3 in 16CF41
S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- AODA and follow through with therapy or treatment
- Mental Health Assessment and follow through with threapy or treatment
- Medications taken as prescribed 
- DE to provide his probation agent with mental health records
- MRT at the recommendation of the probation agent
- DE to report to the DRC to provide a DNA sample
- Court will grant early discharge from probation after 2 years if the DE is in compliance with all the conditions of probation
- Court orders costs of $1,036.00  Apply bond on file and refund balance back to the payor
- DE to report to probation 
- 20 days to appeal


Court questions the DE on 16TR935.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct. 1.  Court finds the DE guilty of Ct. 1.  Crt orders: AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment.  6 month driver's license revocation.  Costs of $811.50.  Apply money on file and refund balance to payor.  On Motion of the State and without objection the Crt dismisses 17TR2640, 16TR550, 16TR551, 16TR552 & 16TR553.  Court adjourned.  lw

Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  There is an agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO Contest to Ct 1 & Ct. 3 in 16CF41.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE guilty of Ct 1 & Ct. 3 in 16CF41. On motion of the State without objection, Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 2 in 16CF41 and reads in and dismisses 16CF401, 16CF204, 16CF185 & 16CF23.  Crt orders a PSI.  SEH can be scheduled after the court has reviewed the PSI.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw
